text.p: Click on a column header to sort the table.

ROW.title: Use Panorama Viewer
ROW.tagdesc: Whether to show this image in a panorama viewer rather than as a normal flat image. This may be specified based on user preferences or by the stitching software. The application displaying or ingesting the image may choose to ignore this.

ROW.title: Capture Software
ROW.tagdesc: If capture was done using an application on a mobile device, such as an Android phone, the name of the application that was used (such as "Photo Sphere"). This should be left blank if source images were captured manually, such as by using a DSLR on a tripod.

ROW.title: Stitching Software
ROW.tagdesc: The software that was used to create the final panorama. This may sometimes be the same value as that of GPano:CaptureSoftware.

ROW.title: Projection Type
ROW.tagdesc: Projection type used in the image file. Google products currently support the value equirectangular.

ROW.title: Pose Heading Degrees
ROW.tagdesc: Compass heading, measured in degrees, for the center the image. Value must be >= 0 and < 360.

ROW.title: Pose Pitch Degrees
ROW.tagdesc: Pitch, measured in degrees, for the center in the image. Value must be >= -90 and <= 90.

ROW.title: Pose Roll Degrees
ROW.tagdesc: Roll, measured in degrees, of the image where level with the horizon is 0. Value must be > -180 and <= 180.

ROW.title: Initial View Heading Degrees
ROW.tagdesc: The heading angle of the initial view in degrees.

ROW.title: Initial View Pitch Degrees
ROW.tagdesc: The pitch angle of the initial view in degrees.

ROW.title: Initial View Roll Degrees
ROW.tagdesc: The roll angle of the initial view in degrees.

ROW.title: Initial Horizontal FOV Degrees
ROW.tagdesc: The initial horizontal field of view that the viewer should display (in degrees). This is similar to a zoom level.

ROW.title: First Photo Date
ROW.tagdesc: Date and time for the first image created in the panorama.

ROW.title: Last Photo Date
ROW.tagdesc: Date and time for the last image created in the panorama.

ROW.title: Source Photos Count
ROW.tagdesc: Number of source images used to create the panorama

ROW.title: Exposure Lock Used
ROW.tagdesc: When individual source photographs were captured, whether or not the camera's exposure setting was locked.

ROW.title: Cropped Area Image Width Pixels
ROW.tagdesc: Original width in pixels of the image (equal to the actual image's width for unedited images).

ROW.title: Cropped Area Image Height Pixels
ROW.tagdesc: Original height in pixels of the image (equal to the actual image's height for unedited images).

ROW.title: Full Pano Width Pixels
ROW.tagdesc: Original full panorama width from which the image was cropped. Or, if only a partial panorama was captured, this specifies the width of what the full panorama would have been.

ROW.title: Full Pano Height Pixels
ROW.tagdesc: Original full panorama height from which the image was cropped. Or, if only a partial panorama was captured, this specifies the height of what the full panorama would have been.

ROW.title: Cropped Area Left Pixels
ROW.tagdesc: Column where the left edge of the image was cropped from the full sized panorama.

ROW.title: Cropped Area Top Pixels
ROW.tagdesc: Row where the top edge of the image was cropped from the full sized panorama.

ROW.title: Initial Camera Dolly
ROW.tagdesc: This optional parameter moves the virtual camera position along the line of sight, away from the center of the photo sphere. A rear surface position is represented by the value -1.0, while a front surface position is represented by 1.0. For normal viewing, this parameter should be set to 0.
